ğŸš€ DÃ©marrage Rapideïƒ

Installationïƒ

# Installation depuis PyPI (recommandÃ©)
pip install hrneowave

# Ou installation depuis les sources
git clone https://github.com/laboratoire-maritime/chneowave.git
cd chneowave
pip install -e .

Lancementïƒ

# Lancement de l'interface graphique
chneowave

# Ou depuis Python
python -m hrneowave.gui.main

Premier Projetïƒ

  1. CrÃ©er un nouveau projet depuis lâ€™interface dâ€™accueil

  2. Configurer lâ€™acquisition (frÃ©quence, durÃ©e, capteurs)

  3. Lancer lâ€™acquisition et visualiser en temps rÃ©el

  4. Analyser les donnÃ©es avec les outils intÃ©grÃ©s

  5. Exporter les rÃ©sultats en HDF5, PDF, Excel

ğŸ“Š Exemples dâ€™Utilisationïƒ

Acquisition ProgrammÃ©eïƒ

from hrneowave.core import AcquisitionManager
from hrneowave.hardware import SimulatedAdapter

# Configuration de l'acquisition
manager = AcquisitionManager()
adapter = SimulatedAdapter(channels=8, fs=1000)

# Lancement de l'acquisition
session = manager.start_acquisition(
    adapter=adapter,
    duration=60.0,
    project_path="./mon_projet"
)

# Attendre la fin
session.wait_completion()
print(f"DonnÃ©es sauvegardÃ©es: {session.output_file}")

Analyse Spectraleïƒ

from hrneowave.analysis import SpectralAnalyzer
import h5py

# Charger les donnÃ©es
with h5py.File("session_data.h5", "r") as f:
    data = f["data/raw_data"][:]
    fs = f["metadata"].attrs["sampling_frequency"]

# Analyse spectrale
analyzer = SpectralAnalyzer(window_size=1024)
results = analyzer.analyze(data, fs)

print(f"FrÃ©quence de pic: {results.peak_frequency:.2f} Hz")
print(f"Hauteur significative: {results.significant_height:.3f} m")

ğŸ”§ Configurationïƒ

CHNeoWave utilise un systÃ¨me de configuration flexible basÃ© sur YAML :

# config.yaml
acquisition:
  default_fs: 1000
  default_duration: 60.0
  buffer_size: 8192

analysis:
  fft_window: "hann"
  overlap_ratio: 0.5
  frequency_bands: [0.05, 0.5, 2.0]

export:
  default_formats: ["hdf5", "pdf", "excel"]
  compression: "gzip"
